intro: Talisia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian talisia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, white to pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Talisia peruviana is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it adaptable to various garden settings.
